definition: Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: True happiness is of a retired nature, and enemy to pomp and noise.
sentences.chinese: 真正的幸福不顯山露水，它擯棄浮華和喧囂。

sentences.english: Everywhere there are meretricious actions and opportunism; everywhere there is an expectation of simple orders.
sentences.chinese: 到處勃發着浮華和機遇，到處期待着樸素的秩序。

sentences.english: Grandiosity is always a cover for despair.
sentences.chinese: 浮華虛誇一向是爲了掩飾內在的絕望。

sentences.english: Art cannot rival this pomp of purple and gold.
sentences.chinese: 浮華的金紫，絕非畫師所能描繪。

sentences.english: The grandiosity of the ego is its alternative to the grandeur of God.
sentences.chinese: 小我欲以它的浮華虛誇來取代上主的莊嚴偉大。

sentences.english: What's the flashiest thing he's bought?
sentences.chinese: 那麼他自己買過的最浮華的東西是什麼呢？

sentences.english: Under her lace and glitz, he wore a jockstrap.
sentences.chinese: 在“她”的蕾絲和浮華後面是他的護襠。

sentences.english: We will just grow up being superficial and vain. What kind of people will we become?
sentences.chinese: 長大之後浮華不實，能做個什麼樣的人呢？

sentences.english: the gaudy butterfly is sure that the flowers owe thanks to him.
sentences.chinese: 浮華的蝴蝶卻相信花是應該向它叩謝的。

sentences.english: What kind of people will we become?
sentences.chinese: 長大之後浮華不實，能做個什麼樣的人呢？

sentences.english: Throughdiamond windows flagstone wall, you can seevaried occurrences of theworldand have everyfeelingofhuman life.
sentences.chinese: 金鋼窗，條石牆，看窗外世事變幻，感人生浮華萬象。

sentences.english: Furthermore, she never used her position to indulge in extravagances or covetously harm the emperor's concubines.
sentences.chinese: 更不曾以自己的地位，而奢侈浮華，或妒害嬪妃。

sentences.english: But there was a dark side to this world of gold and luxurious living.
sentences.chinese: 但這紙醉金迷的浮華生活也有黑暗的一面。

sentences.english: Its contour succinct simple, does not have the excessive ostentatiousness.
sentences.chinese: 其外形簡練樸素，沒有過度的浮華。

sentences.english: Hollywood shines with glitz, over-the-top special effects and expensive film productions.
sentences.chinese: 好萊塢閃耀着浮華，過了頂特效和昂貴的電影製作。

definition: the world of mortals (Buddhism)/human society/worldly affairs
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
